entry.title: requestFullscreen not implemented in headless shell
entry.content:
requestFullscreen not implemented in headless shell, and that is causing many WPTs to timeout. Some of them are listed below:
external/wpt/html/semantics/popovers/popover-top-layer-nesting-anchor.tentative.html external/wpt/html/semantics/popovers/popover-top-layer-nesting-hints.tentative.html external/wpt/html/semantics/popovers/popover-top-layer-nesting.tentative.html And around 50 tests in external/wpt/fullscreen/
How to reproduce: $autoninja -C out/Release chrome chromedriver $third_party/blink/tools/run_wpt_tests.py --release -p headless_shell the-test-name

entry.title: Deep scan notice padding is incorrect
entry.content: UX informs me the padding should be more even on both sides of the icon (see screenshot). This is unfortunate, because it means we're extending into the DownloadBubbleRowView border.

entry.title: Fix NewTabPage preloading experiment
entry.content:
To restart the launch experiment of NewTabPage (NTP) preloading trigger, we should inspect implementation and fix all known issues.
See issue 326509142 for the context.

entry.title: ViewHighlighter lies on nullable ConstantState from the background
entry.content: ViewHighlighter relies on Drawable#getConstantState() which is nullable according to the docs. This will NPE in some cases, so an alternative should be found to support this.

entry.title: Add Compose.Session.EventCounts UMA for edit results
entry.content:
Copied from https://b.corp.google.com/issues/335463989
Add two events along the lines of: - ResultEdited - EditedResultInserted

entry.title: Have submodules with new commits after running gclient sync
entry.content:
When checking out tip of tree (git fetch && git rebase && gclient sync), I often have new commits on submodules, even though gclient sync successfully runs.
``` yangsharon@sy:~/chromium/src$ gclient sync -D Syncing projects: 100% (436/436), done. Running hooks: 23% (52/218) perfetto_testdata ________ running 'vpython3 src/base/tracing/test/test_data.py download' in '/usr/local/google/home/yangsharon/chromium' Nothing to do, all files are synced Running hooks: 100% (218/218), done. yangsharon@sy:~/chromium/src$ git status On branch tokenmap1 Your branch and 'origin/main' have diverged, and have 1 and 268 different commits each, respectively. (use "git pull" if you want to integrate the remote branch with yours)
Changes not staged for commit: (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed) (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory) modified: third_party/chromite (new commits)
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a") ```
My local .gclient config: ``` solutions = [ { "url": "https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git", "managed": False, "name": "src", "custom_deps": {}, "custom_vars": { "checkout_telemetry_dependencies": True, "checkout_src_internal": True, "download_remoteexec_cfg": True, } } ] target_os = [ # "fuchsia", "android", # "win", # "mac" ] ```

entry.title: Many Fedcm tests crashed when perform garbage collection
entry.content:
Take external/wpt/credential-management/fedcm-auto-reauthn-without-approved-clients.https.html in [1] for example, the crash stack is as below:
#0 0x5647a8f01972 base::debug::CollectStackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:1039:7] #1 0x5647a8eea38e base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:236:20] #2 0x5647a8deb8d9 logging::LogMessage::Flush() [../../base/logging.cc:706:29] #3 0x5647a8deb7bd logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage() [../../base/logging.cc:697:3] #4 0x5647a8dd194f logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage() [../../base/check.cc:166:3] #5 0x5647a8dd19ae logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage() [../../base/check.cc:161:32] #6 0x5647a8dd1423 logging::CheckError::~CheckError() [../../third_party/libc++/src/include/__memory/unique_ptr.h:67:5] #7 0x5647ad13ed76 blink::ScriptPromiseResolverBase::Dispose() [../../third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/script_promise_resolver.cc:72:5] #8 0x5647ad13ebba blink::ScriptPromiseResolverBase::InvokePreFinalizer() [../../third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/script_promise_resolver.h:75:3] #9 0x5647a52a6a66 cppgc::internal::PreFinalizerHandler::InvokePreFinalizers() [../../v8/src/heap/cppgc/prefinalizer-handler.cc:74:31] #10 0x5647a52975b7 cppgc::internal::HeapBase::ExecutePreFinalizers() [../../v8/src/heap/cppgc/heap-base.cc:169:26] #11 0x5647a43cc720 v8::internal::CppHeap::FinishMarkingAndStartSweeping() [../../v8/src/heap/cppgc-js/cpp-heap.cc:928:51] #12 0x5647a445156d v8::internal::Heap::PerformGarbageCollection() [../../v8/src/heap/heap.cc:2434:32] #13 0x5647a4474a76 v8::internal::Heap::CollectGarbage()::$_0::operator()() [../../v8/src/heap/heap.cc:1881:9] #14 0x5647a4474636 heap::base::Stack::SetMarkerAndCallbackImpl<>() [../../v8/src/heap/base/stack.h:168:5] #15 0x5647a52b50bb PushAllRegistersAndIterateStack

entry.title: [User Feedback - Stable] Users report audio playback is not working on M124 on MacOS
entry.content:
Affected Chrome Version(s): 124.0.6367.61, 124.0.6367.62
Affected Operating Systems: Multiple MacOS (12.5.0, 12.6.1, 12.6.4, 13.5.2)
Issue Description + Insights/Patterns: * We have a moderate amount of user feedback from M124 MacOS users sharing that audio playback is not working after updating. * Users mention performing extensive troubleshooting, and confirming the issue is isolated to Chrome browser. * Multiple users mention specific audio devices or sound cards that are impacted, such as Apollo and RME Fireface. It isn't clear if the issue is isolated to these brands, specific USB audio devices, or an issue with wider impact.
Highlighted User Voice Examples (Access: http://shortn/_0E2VFlfXQ2): * Mentions Specific Audio Device / Sound Card Brand: * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695190067 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695133790 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695031347 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91694788501 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91694516649 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91694133660 * Generic Audio Not Working: * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695328469 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695314130 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695195438 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695099265 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695089279 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91695031347 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91694611395 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91693959203 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91693154338
Thanks!

entry.title: Ffh
entry.content: Ffh

entry.title: Too-long report URLs can cause script process kills
entry.content:
GURLs have no length limit, but passing a GURL over 2MB across Mojo results in an empty, invalid GURL being passed, despite the original GURL being valid. InterestGroupAuctionReporter reports bad messages when it gets an invalid GURL, but we do no length checks before sending them across Mojo to that class. This can result in killing the process that runs scripts, and failing to send report URLs.
The is the case for both ReportTo() URLs and even level reporting beacon URLs (no idea about the aggregate stuff). We should just print a warning and throw away the URLs instead.

entry.title: Run ClusterTelemetry to aggregate Graphite pipeline types
Expose clipboard APIs in Chrome Devtools Protocol
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem N/A
# Problem Description Microsoft Playwright and Cypress both use or expose the CDP for running tests. It would be great if the CDP exposed clipboard interactions so that native clipboard functionality could be tested. Dispatching clipboard events from JS doesn't work because of security restrictions.
(I'm not a developer of either test framework, so I might be wrong about this being a smart approach.)
# Additional Comments See: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/2752 See: https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/15860
# Summary Expose clipboard APIs in Chrome Devtools Protocol
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Save tab group MergeGroup is not working correctly in tab group v2.
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6425.0 OS: Desktop
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Enable chrome://flags/#tab-groups-save-ui-update (2) Open Chrome Canary in computer 1, sign into gmail account and turn on sync. Create some pinned saved tab groups. (3) Open Chrome Canary in computer 2, sign into the same gmail account and turn on sync. (4) Unpin an pinned tab group in computer 1, wait for 10 seconds
What is the expected result? The tab group unpinned in computer 1 should become unpinned in computer 2
What happens instead? The tab group unpinned in computer 2 is still pinned and move into the first place in computer 2.

entry.title: Replace placeholder icon with open source shield icon for ESB Download Row Promo
entry.content: In crrev.com/c/5385705, we came to the conclusion on using a placeholder dummy icon while figuring out the next steps for the branded g shield icon. As of right now, we figured out the next steps so we are replacing the dummy icon with a more suitable open-source shield icon until the g shield icon is ready to be used.

entry.title: [Mac][Regression, not behind flag] Scrollbar not hidden during loading states
entry.content: On Mac, styles are not being correctly applied to hide the scrollbar UI when the dialog is in a loading state. This affects the compose dialog without EnableUiRefinements flag applied.

entry.title: Improve disable tests accuracy for Chrome gardeners
entry.content:
See how gardeners would be confused by the current setup. https://chromium.slack.com/archives/CGJ5WKRUH/p1713382142038409 Gardeners don't usually have the knowledge to disable tests for all platforms. Also, it happens a lot that a test is disabled for more builders than we intended to disable. This results us losing coverage. As an example, let's say a gardener wants to disable a flaky test for 'Linux Tests', they usually just do BUILDFLAG(IS_LINUX) This disables on a lot more builders than we want to. They can disable by BUILDFLAG(IS_LINUX) && !BUILDFLAG(GOOGLE_CHROME_BRANDING) && !BUILDFLAG(DEBUG)
One thing we could do is add descriptions for each builder to give a more scoped mechanism to disable a test.

entry.title: Chrome windows invisible under GNOME Wayland with #ozone-platform-hint=wayland
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome 2. See nothing
# Problem Description I use Chrome Stable v124.0.6367.60 in GNOME 44.3. I use the default GNOME under Wayland because, amongst other things, it lets me have working fractional scaling on a laptop and external monitor so I have set `#ozone-platform-hint` to Wayland in chrome://flags. After the latest update (which I applied today) I relaunched and only saw an invisible window. The window does have a size, can be maximized, captures clicks and keyboard input like normal except that it is completely transparent. The only way to fix it was to open a fallback GNOME X11 session and set that platform hint field to X11 which runs Chrome in an XWayland compatibility layer. This works but is suboptimal since the scaling will be blurry on one screen.
# Summary Chrome windows invisible under GNOME Wayland with #ozone-platform-hint=wayland
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Keyboard focus is not clearly visible on 'added watch expression' and 'delete watch expression' buttons in 'Source' tab.
entry.content:
Repro Steps: Launch Chrome and open any web page. Open developer tools(Hit F12 or More options-> More Tools-> Developer Tools)​. Select 'Sources' tab item and invoke it. Navigate to 'Watch' tree item and expand it. Navigate to 'Add watch' button and invoke it. Navigate to the added watch expressions and delete watch expression buttons. Observe the behavior here.
Actual Result: Keyboard focus is not clearly visible on 'added watch expression' and 'delete watch expression' buttons in 'Source' tab. On hitting Tab from 'refresh watch expressions' button, focus is moving to the 'added watch edit field', but it is not clearly visible.
Expected Result: Keyboard focus should be clearly visible for added watch expressions edit field and delete watch expression button. Visually also 'delete watch expression' button should be present while user navigate using Tab key.

entry.title: Improve visitation of JavaScript objects
entry.content: Visitation of JS objects dominates marking and also Scavenge. There's various ways using static roots to improve visitation of objects.

entry.title: CachedFlagUtils SharedPreference writes could be batched
entry.content:
The `cacheNativeFlags()` and `cacheFieldTrialParameters()` methods in `CachedFlagUtils` result in 75 and 50 calls to `SharedPreferences#apply()`, respectively, during startup in `onStartWithNative()`.
These SharedPreference updates can be batched to avoid making the expensive call to `SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commitToMemory()`, which copies the in-memory map of SharedPreferences, more often than we need to.
Attached is a screenshot of a trace taken during ChromePublic startup.

entry.title: Continue button does not work
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem? fill out the form and push the Continue button.
What is the expected result? continue to next page to log in to my account.
What happens instead? Nothing happens.
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Implement ML scoring signals for Search suggestions
entry.content:
Based on a chat with manukh@, we've identified the following potential next steps with regards to implementing ML scoring signals for Search suggestions in the Omnibox:
""" 1) the server's search score is probably the most important signal. Because the server knows more about the suggestion than chromium does.
2) The other info in the search response (is entity & search subtype) might also be useful. Maybe entities are more/less useful than non-entities; and the model could adjust the server scores. Though this is less useful than the server scores because i imagine the server scores already account for this info. So it'd only be useful if we think the small local model can better consider this than the veteran server model
3) Local match info. E.g. how many times the user's done the search previously. Shortcut provider already suggests searches, so we'll get shortcut signals when they're deduped. But HQP doesn't seem suggest searches. We rely on the search provider to provide search-history suggestions. Maybe we can either rely on the HQP annotator to add the typed count, visit count, etc signals.
4) Local input info. This might be useful for the other match types as well. If a human was asked to rank omnbiox suggestions, they'd probably consider things like "if the input looks like a question, then the user probably wants to do a search, so rank searches higher". We don't haven't created a "does the input look like a question" algorithm, but maybe the model can figure it out based on signals like input length, whitespace count, etc. """

entry.title: Set up Dawn Win/ARM64 compilation
entry.content:
b/321127115 and b/332562046 track the allocation of GCE resources for Dawn Win/ARM64 builders. This bug is to track getting the actual builders online:
* CI DEPS compiler * CI ToT compiler * DEPS trybot * ToT trybot
Note that we are not ready to enable tests yet, so we will only be compiling.

entry.title: Embedded test server potentially has issues with 2MB buffers
entry.content:
I'm writing a "large URL" test with the EmbeddedTestServer. Each test makes a request for a URL with a body of length 2,097,723, and then one for a URL with a response body of length 2,097,722. Both cases use a BasicHttpResponse over HTTP/1.1. On OSX, in 2-3 test runs out of 30, fetching the first URL returns an ERR_CONTENT_LENGTH_MISMATCH, after reading 2,080,768 bytes (always that number, apparently) of the 2,097,723 bytes. I have yet to see a failure fetching the second URL.
My guess is the "2,080,768" comes from one read to our header buffer (which is 16k), and 63 full reads of our 32k body buffer, so the next read (which should also be our last read) should cross the 2MB barrier and hit the end of the request.
I suspect what's happening is OSX has a 2MB write buffer, we hit it when writing the response, the next write is async, and the async path falls over somehow, but not seeing how that can happen.
That having been said, it could be a production bug, or something else could be going down entirely.
Can't repro locally on Windows. I don't plan to dig further into this, for now.
The CL where I ran into this issue: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5443530/20 (Patch set 20, content/browser/interest_group/interest_group_browsertest.cc. I've landed the CL without those tests, so just patching that one file and running the bots on top of tree should repro)
